metadata.feature_description: Configure profanity handling across all modules with options to filter content, prohibit content, or allow all content.

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Community Settings panel opens with Profanity Filtering section visible
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened successfully with Profanity Filtering dropdown visible showing 'Filter Content' as current value

steps.action: Click on Profanity Filtering dropdown to view options
steps.expected: Dropdown shows three options: Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all three options as expected with Filter Content highlighted

steps.action: Select 'Prohibit Content' from the Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should update to show 'Prohibit Content' as selected
steps.actual: Prohibit Content was successfully selected and displayed in the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings should save with success notification
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' notification displayed

steps.action: Select 'No Filtering' from the Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should update to show 'No Filtering' as selected
steps.actual: No Filtering was successfully selected and displayed in the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings should save with success notification
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' notification displayed

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save profanity filter setting and verify persistence

steps.action: After saving 'No Filtering', navigate away from Community Settings by clicking Dashboard
Navigate back to Settings > Community to verify persistence
steps.expected: Profanity Filtering should still show 'No Filtering' as the saved value
steps.actual: Profanity Filtering shows 'Filter Content' instead of the saved 'No Filtering' value - setting did not persist

issues: CRITICAL: Profanity Filter setting does not persist after saving. The save operation appears successful (shows 'Item successfully saved' message), but upon re-opening the Community Settings panel, the value reverts to 'Filter Content' regardless of what was previously saved.
Other settings in the same panel (Comments Page Size, Group Home Page) also appear to revert to different values, suggesting a broader persistence issue with Community Settings

observations: All three profanity filter options (Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering) are available in the UI dropdown as documented
The save operation displays a success notification but the settings do not actually persist
This appears to be a bug where the CmxSettings save API may not be properly storing the ProfanityFilter value, or the GetSettings API is returning cached/default values
The feature code in CommunitySettings.js correctly sends the profanityFilter value in the saveSettings function, but persistence fails
